contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox VG |title= X-Men: Wolverine's Rage |image= [[Image:X-Men - Wolverine's Rage Coverart.png]] |caption= |developer=[[Digital Eclipse]] |publisher=[[Activision]] |distributor= |designer= |series= |engine= |version= |released= {{vgrelease|NA= May 15, 2001}}{{vgrelease|EU= June 15, 2001}} |genre= [[Action game|Action]] |modes= [[Single player]] |ratings= [[Entertainment Software Rating Board|ESRB]]: E (Everyone) |platforms= [[Game Boy Color]] |media= |requirements= |input= }} '''''X-Men: Wolverine's Rage''''' is a [[side-scrolling video game]] for the [[Game Boy Color]]. ''Wolverine's Rage'' follows the story of [[Wolverine (comics)|Wolverine]] as he chases down [[Lady Deathstrike]], [[Sabretooth (comics)|Sabretooth]], and [[Cyber (comics)|Cyber]]. ==Gameplay== Gameplay in ''Wolverine's Rage'' is relatively simple and repetitive. There are twenty levels in the game, grouped into chapters of five with a [[Boss (video games)|boss]] battle at the end of each one. If Wolverine is hurt he can regenerate his health back. The objective on most of the levels is to run through them before time runs out, battling enemies on the way. There is no save system in ''Wolverine's Rage'', instead after completing a level you are given a [[Password (video games)|password]]. ==Story== Lady Deathstrike discovers schematics allowing her to build a weapon that will melt Wolverine's [[adamantium]] skeleton. Lady Deathstrike decides to go ahead with the machine and Wolverine has to do whatever it takes to track her down and stop her. ==Reception== The game has received mixed-to-positive reviews from critics and fans alike. ==See also== *[[X-Men: Mutant Academy]] *[[X-Men: Mutant Wars]] ==External links== *{{GameSpot|id=478103|name=''X-Men:Wolverine's Rage''}} *{{GameFAQs|id=478103|name=''X-Men:Wolverine's Rage''}} *{{IGN|type=gameboy|id=016/016364|name=X-Men:Wolverine's Rage}} *{{moby game|id=/x-men-wolverines-rage|name=''X-Men: Wolverine's Rage''}} {{Wolverine}} {{Marvel Video Games}} {{X-Men media}} [[Category:2001 video games]] [[Category:Game Boy Color games]] [[Category:Action video games]] {{Action-videogame-stub}}
